alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Grand Isle; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin; Western Rutland (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 5:59AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Heavy snow will impact portions of Clinton, Franklin, southeastern St. Lawrence, and Essex Counties in New York, and Addison, Grand Isle, Chittenden, northwestern Rutland and Franklin Counties in Vermont through 700 AM EDT... At 557 AM EDT, an area of heavy snow was reported along a line extending from 26 miles north of Highgate, Vermont to near Raquette Lake, New York. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Visibility less than a half mile, and snow accumulation up to 1 inch per hour. Roads will be snow covered and slippery. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Plattsburgh International Airport, Burlington, Tupper Lake, Burlington International Airport, Saranac Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Plattsburgh, Middlebury, South Burlington, Vergennes, Lake Placid, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Moriah, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers and Altona. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 78 and 129.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Eastern Franklin; Grand Isle; Western Addison; Western Chittenden; Western Franklin; Western Rutland
